text: artist album title hi everyone
Anthony Pham tanto here Internet's
busiest be a second 'red it's time for
your review of the new Bring Me The
Horizon album sempiternal these guys are
a UK based metal outfit from what I
understand they have been together for
about ten years at this point
this latest LP of theirs is allegedly
their most creative and ambitious
musical endeavor yet and a breath of
fresh air in some extreme music genres
that consistently catch a bad rap for
lack of creativity and fresh ideas like
metalcore and certainly in comparison
with other metalcore acts you could say
that to an extent bringing The Horizon
is being pretty forward-thinking on a
number of tracks on this new LP like the
opening track on here can you feel my
heart there's a lot of electronic skits
and edits throughout this track soaring
guitars that glisten and fly over the
chorus epically catchy synthesizer
melodies sort of spread throughout the
track too there are a lot of elements of
this track and other tracks on this
album that actually remind me of like
hybrid theory era Linkin Park in a good
way with the screams that the band's
lead singer dishes out kind of reminded
me of Chester Bennington screams as well
but I don't think the influences that
this album showcases stop at just Linkin
Park a lot of the more pleasant more
melodic elements of this new album
actually remind me of quite a bit of
radio metal acts from the early 2000s
there are other tracks on this LP that
don't really sort quite as much they go
a bit harder they have a bit of a more
cutting edge they pummel the listener
with the monstrously produced rips that
are locked in step with little bass
drums and the band adds some dynamics to
this track much like they do on other
songs here with kind of a quieter
interlude with some group vocals a bit
of glistening piano out in the distance
the band does work pretty hard to
diversify their sound across this album
always throwing something maybe that's
quieter or a little bit more melodic at
the listener so that they're not always
simply getting this riffing the song
Empire does this as well but with like
what seems to be a string
action on the song and the band's
frontman Oliver Sykes very smoothly
switches from these screen vocals to
some actually pretty nice cleanly sung
vocals as well and though I don't really
see anything technically bad with
Oliver's singing he can be kind of
melodramatic at times when he's going
for maybe a little bit of spoken-word
whether it's him or another member of
the band on a given track or when he
seems to be singing or screaming at the
top of his lungs some pretty cliched
lyrics about finding your way back home
Hart's writing on the wall letting
people sing or being on the edge of the
world
and you can't really take them for any
more than they're extremely melodramatic
face-value
it's really actually quite difficult to
connect with this album in a direct or
meaningfully emotional way unless you're
just really kind of looking for that
because a lot of the things that Oliver
seems to sing about at least to me
anyway
he's pretty vague at times with the
things that he says it's just that it
doesn't really come out to be all that
impressive poetically there's just a
real lack of inspiring emotion on this
album despite the fact that the band
consistently seems to be shooting for
something really epic all the time it
just all kind of seems like it's only
relative to this overproduced pop rock
offshoot of metalcore music sure there
are choruses on this album that reach
for the stars but numerous tracks on
this thing are loaded with dime-a-dozen
boring uninspired metalcore riffing and
breakdowns the riffs don't really hit
any interesting or unique angles or
grooves much of the time it's just kind
of weird that the band is really sort of
reaching for something that they think
is kind of ambitious and beautiful but
they match it together with these
musical ideas that are just so lowbrow
these kinds of metalcore riffs and
listen I don't mean to diss every
metalcore band out there they're
fantastic bands and albums in the genre
but what I'm saying is these particular
riffs work on a formula that's is
obvious as the dubstep drop but it's
four times as stale because it's been
around longer certainly I do admire that
the band wanted to do something
different I like certain parts on tracks
like the chorus isn't like the melodies
like the sense like the post
inspired climax on the song hospitals
for souls
clearly the band has an ability to
change things up but it just seems they
refuse to get rid of their addiction to
this metalcore style of riffing that
they seem as stuck on as little Wayne is
stuck on writing rhymes about his dick
so I mean I'm really kind of feeling up
strong for it to a light five on this
thing if you guys have given it a listen
what did you think of it did you love it
